intro: Tetracera forzzae, commonly known as the Malayan tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cupular inflorescences. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, humid environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
